title.narrative: IMPROVED CAPACITY TO DEMAND ACCESS TO QUALITY SOCIAL SERVICES.

description.narrative: Poorest households, children and adolescents have improved capacity to demand access to quality social services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Poorest households, children and adolescents have improved capacity to demand access to quality social services.

description.narrative: Various interventions were implemented in selected districts to strengthen the capacity of children, youth and adults to advocate for more investments in basic services through their involvement in planning and budgeting processes. This culminated in a budget hearing at Parliament in which children advocated for more investment in social sectors ahead of the 2020/21 budget vote. Information systems were strengthened in Local Development Entities Agency (LODA) for better planning and management of resources based on the socio-economic profile of the population. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/08/2020

title.narrative: # of officials who effectively disseminate the community sensitisation manual
Community sensitisation strategy developed and rolled out
